Reviews.Title: “Clean and great for one night stay”
Reviews.Author: GAGurl_90
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the New Years Eve, last night of our US family vacation before we flew back to the US. The hotel is within walking distance of the airport, approx 1 mile. After a week of walking, that was excruciating. Unfortunately, to get off the train at the Airport, you have to pay a special airport tarriff, so this is not a station you want go back and forth to. It was fine for us because it was our last night and we decided not to go down to City Central to see the fireworks. If we had, it would have been expensive to leave and come back on the train. We watched the fireworks from a little window on one of the upper floors.....saw only part of them....but at least we can see we saw them. There are several fast food restraunts right next door which was handy and in our price range. Staff was very nice and extremely helpful. We had a problem with our toilet, and someone came up immediately and fixed for us. We did not eat onsite or use the laundry facilities. We would stay here again if the need arises.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for purpose”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you need a last minute booking close to the airport and just for the night, this will do. Close to the hotel are: KFC, McDonals and other fast food outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you need to be by the airport, this is an adequate place, but offers nothing special. You can actually walk from the domestic terminal. Rooms are very small and sparse. The breakfast is minimal and way overpriced, so don't waste your money. Go to McDonalds or Krispy Kreme right beside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Waikatoman
Reviews.Content: did the job, close to airport,plenty of parking,clean but basic. Breakfast was OK but once again basic. would not recommend a long stay. Cannot book in early. Double bed with bunk over top.

Reviews.Title: “Close to domestic terminal, clean quiet and basic”
Reviews.Author: MollyFW
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned about staying here. However it was fine. It is was it is and no pretenses, its just very basic, but the bed was ok, the shower worked, it was clean, surprisingly quiet and secure and less than 10 minutes walk to Virgin check in. Just don't expect any frills.

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one night, this hotel is placed in a gr8 location..... close to quite a no. of amenities, value for the money... however the sleep quality is not so gr8, there seems to some problem with the ventilation in the rooms (which are already crammed!!).

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Headwington
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 times now and we have finally had enough. The location is excellent literally 5 minutes from the airport ( you can see it from the plane) But honestly is it too much to ask for that their be enough towels for everyone in the room. We stayed for 3 nights. When we arrived there was 3 towels, the next day only 3 towels were replaced ( 1 missing ) and the next day only 2 towels were present. If 4 people are booked in the room shouldn't they at least provide enough towels!! The soundproofing on the windows is amazing- you would not know the airport was across the road. However, the doors and walls lacked any sort of soundproofing. All day and night you could hear people talking and walking down the hallway. There's a sign in the room that says report any inappropriate noise to management and they will deal with it. This means nothing when a group of at least 10 males are having a all night party complete with music with their door open. 3 times we asked management to tell them to shut their door, 3 times we were laughed at. Stay here no longer then 2 nights. Right next door to Krispy Kream, Mc Donalds and KFC.

Reviews.Title: “What a filthy dump”
Reviews.Author: Rick E
Reviews.Content: Reserved a room months in advance, paid for it, and ended up taking one look and walking out! Walls looked like they had been puked on, the sheets were stained and actually had GUM on them. A real pigsty...don't waste yor time and money, you'll be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget place to stay close to the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Helen F
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying here. We walked the 10 mins to this motel after catching the train to the airport ready for our early flight the next morning. We would have walked back with our trolley bags the next morning but it was raining so we booked the shuttle for $6 each to catch the bus to the airport. We found the bed comfortable and we had a good night's sleep. We had a view of the airport and the room was surprisingly quiet. There are 3 takeaways on your doorstep to choose from and vending machines which give a good coffee in the hotel for snacks and drinks which we made use of. There is a breakfast for $9 extra if required. We booked here because it was the cheapest option and we only needed somewhere to sleep before our flight. The staff were very friendly and helpful on arrival. We actually made a mistake with our online booking and had booked the following night by mistake but they fixed it up quickly (which they were in their rights to refuse to do but we appreciated this greatly). We would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, good location, rooms surprisingly quiet!”
Reviews.Author: BCAussie03 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband & 4 year old stayed one night at the Formula 1 before our international flight. We booked because it was the cheapest option. We flew into the Domestic Terminal and caught a taxi over to the hotel ($12 vs $6 per person shuttle). The staff were lovely, friendly and got us checked in asap (room 319). We had booked the most basic room. The room was cozy (small) with a double bed and a bunk on top. It had a small tv and bathroom. It was clean and comfortable. And I was surprised at how quiet the room was as there were planes flying right past our window - you wouldn't have known unless you were looking. I would recommend the Formula 1 to anyone who is looking for a basic room for the night. There wasn't a fridge in the room but they did have vending machines in the lobby. McDonalds, Krispie Creme & KFC were within walking distance. I probably wouldn't recommend this place to anyone who is staying for an extended stay or prefers extra amenties onsite and in the rooms. Also in-room wifi was only available for a charge. They did have a free internet terminal available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, functional and noisy with a good location”
Reviews.Author: Brydonandcoogan
Reviews.Content: Basic room with poor bathroom facilities that lack a shower curtain causing water leakage in to the room as others have said. The soundproofing was good with regards to the exterior airport noise but the interior noise was awful an I was kept awake throughout the night with people leaving for early flights. That said, Sydney is notoriously expensive and this was one of the few budget options with such a good location being so close to the airport - we walked to the international terminal. There are a few fast food places next door and we managed to locate some restaurants and shops close by (10-15 minute walk) including a good Italian if McDonald's isn't your thing. Essentially, if you need to stay very close to the airport on a budget for a night this is probably the place for you just don't expect any frills

Reviews.Title: “Basic and convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: Kiwia1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight before taking an early flight. Room small and basic as expected. I slept fine but was tired. For the money was worth it. It saved me getting up at an awful hour and taking an expensive taxi to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Close and easy”
Reviews.Author: NX622
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions. It is fairly basic, as are all the hotels in this chain but the rooms are always clean and the best part of it is the location. It is only a five minute walk from the Virgin Terminal or ten minutes from the Qantas terminal. From the International terminal it is best to get a shuttle bus or taxi. Breakfast is good and includes juices, cereals and toast with various spreads although it doesn't start until about 6am which is a pain if you have an early morning flight. A shuttle can be booked to drop you off at any of the terminals when you leave and only costs about $8 AUD. There are several fast food restaurants next door including Mc Donalds, KFC and Krispy Creme Donuts. There is of course cafes etc in the airport as well. Given the price of the trains to and from the city it is not the best place to stay if you are are visiting downtown Sydney but it is perfect if you are looking for cheap overnight accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: paula_eyler
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location and price. We got what we paid for. The room was clean. The room and bathroom were very small, and minimally furnished. There were no top sheets on the bunk beds. The people hanging around the entrance smoking turned me off the hotel before we even stepped inside.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable price for very basic overnight accomodation at the airport”
Reviews.Author: apaterson
Reviews.Content: I'll be honest. The only reason that I'd ever stay at this Formule 1 hotel is if I was catching a flight the next day. If however, like me, you just want somewhere close to several food options, within a few dollar taxi ride of the domestic and international air terminals, and don't want to spend a fortune doing it, then look no further. I stayed in the Formule 1 hotel in November 2011, with my wife and 2 children. We had a 6am flight to catch the next morning, so we caught the train down to Sydney, and got off at the Sydney domestic terminal station. From there it was a 10 minute walk to the Formule 1. Check was quick and painless, but not overly friendly. The young guy working the wasn't very friendly or welcoming, and my guess that was he was sick of of his job, or life, or both. Either way, after a long train ride with 2 tired children, no chit-chat suited us fine, and we made our way to the room. Yes the rooms are small. Yes the rooms are very basic. I like to call them the F.A. hotel chain (because you get SFA in the way of extras with your room). If you are staying for more than one night, I'd strongly urge you to look elsewhere. If, like us, you want somewhere clean, well priced and as close to the airport terminals as it is possible to get, then the Formule 1 fits the bill nicely. Our room had a double bed, and 2 bunk beds. The bathroom was obviously a pre-manufactured plastic cubicle that the rest of the room was built around, and was small enough that if you angled the shower head right you could shower while sitting on the toilet (which was pretty good fun I must admit). Luxuries in the room were completely absent. It had air conditioning, beds, an alarm clock, a chained down 34cm TV (as if someone would try to steal a 34cm CRT), and not much else. Our room had a single window with majestic sweeping views of a concrete wall. While on our holiday, I kept a nightly trip blog of our adventures. The hotel has no wired internet in the rooms, but it does have paid internet in the lobby, or slightly more expensive wifi available in the room, which I made use of. From memory it was a few dollars for half an hour. The hotel is next door to several food and coffee options. Krispy Kreme is right next door, and next door to that is McDonalds, and KFC is a few doors down from that. both Krispy Kreme and McDonalds have wifi available if you need an free internet connection. There is also a shuttle service to the domestic and international air terminals available. Starting at 6am and arriving every 15 minutes, the service costs $6 per adult. We had to be at the airport much earlier than 6am however, so we rang a taxi, which arrived on time, and worked out to less than $10 to get to the terminal. Much cheaper than a shuttle would have cost us. A tip: If you have more than 1 person, book a taxi instead of catching the shuttle bus. It will work out cheaper. *Much* cheaper if you have 2 or more adults. To summarise, if you're staying for more than 1 night, or you want a few luxuries or award winning service, then look elsewhere. You'll be disappointed, and you'll probably end up here writing a bad review at some point in the future. If however you only need a place to sleep, which is clean, functional, quiet, right at the airport, close to several dining options, and at an absolutely unbeatable price, then Book the F1 hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Does in a pinch”
Reviews.Author: SoCalexpat
Reviews.Content: Did not expect more than a basic room. Was not disappointed on that count. Did not expect a bed so uncomfortable, an A/C unit so loud the planes would have been preferable and no room what so ever except to get to the bed, and that was hard with the luggage in the only space available. However it was clean and very close to domestic, only a short walk. Would not want to try walking to international though, especially with luggage. Don't expect to get much sleep the walls are paper thin and you hear everything especially all the other doors slamming all through the night. But at least you can stretch out before a flight and leave the sleeping for onboard the plane. No restaurant on premises and no facilities to make a cuppa in the room. Fast food places across the parking lot, but we opted to go across the road to a larger hotel for dinner. If you want a quiet place and a good nights sleep this is not the place for you. If you just want to relax on a clean bed and have a nice shower then it is the ticket.

Reviews.Title: “VERY POOR ACCOMMODATION”
Reviews.Author: mrconsult
Reviews.Content: My fiance and myself had to stay over night at the FORMULE1 AT SYDNEY AIRPORT due to JETSTAR canceling our flight at the last minute for no given reason . when we arrived at the hotel all appeared as it shoud when you are greeted at the front desk , and thenwhat or room number was ,we were told where your room is (usual) . we had booked a tripple room which is all they had left at the last minute . then when we had arrived at the room , we were expecting a nice large room which was suppose to accommodate 3 persons adult and/or children , which to our surprise looked more like a deluxe room. The so called 3rd bed was a upper buck , with a mattress that was more suited for a toddlier there was no tea or coffee supplied , not even a kettle to make a cup of of coffe or teas there was no cups only 1 towel ,1 shower mat , 1 small piece of soap with 2 plastic disposiable cups to rinse your mouth out with . the airconditioning was terriable , i am not one who suffers with ashma , but the air was so bad coming from the airducts that i was coffing continously till i turned it off . on three occasions we had somebody during the night try to get into our room. this meant that my sharp alert senses prevented me from getting any proper sleep ( only 2 hours) granted this is an 1-5 day accommodation premies ,but as safety is concerned it also was very poor you could not open the window which meant that if a fire did happen outside the room door you had no way of escaping , the tv was about 15 years old . the shower and tiolet was not of proper standard ,there was no minstrel fan to get rid of any bad smells , the water in the shower ran out to the room instead of all of it running into the drianage. the information booklet ????? was not of proper standard either it was only in English and not the required different languages for foriegn visitors. the beding was not of good quality instead of having aproper doona with a cover all it had was 2 sheets covering a thin doona?????. there was not blankets , one was on the upper bunk but it was too small for our double bed. there was no ironing board , u had to go down to the ground flooor to do any ironing there was no hair drer in the room when my fiance neeed to do here hair . how would i rate this hotel ,well a rating of 1-5 i would give it a 1 and I would have to say that if you are having an affiar or wanted to take a prostitude for a quick session then this is the place . conclusion I would not recomend this hotel to my worse enemy or any of my close friends, it holds a 3 star rateing but I think they might have brought the other 2 stars because for a three star hotel it certainly did not show me how it was worthy of this rating and most defenitly need to be reviewed.

Reviews.Title: “Picked for closeness to airport, with very loud air conditioning, but very hot room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff at the desk along with close proximity to airport were the two best factors that would bring me back to stay. I was staying with my mother and partner and the room was satistactory, if it hadn't been for the very loud air conditioning and the confusing fact of the room still be extremely warm. This meant a Very sporadic sleep which wasn't the best way to start a flight and holiday. Close proximity to airport means however that we would still stay again yet would bring a fan to make the night bearable. Along with requesting a room WITHOUT afternoon sun.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Accommodation Before Jetting Out On Holidays!!!”
Reviews.Author: AussieSteve88
Reviews.Content: When compared to other five-star hotel's I've been to, the Formule 1 doesn't stack up, but considering what I was expecting (little more than a bed and bathroom) I was surprised. The room was bigger than I expected and was dark and quiet, which would have made sleeping easy. However, thge bed was ordinary, to say the least, and was too lumpy to sleep perfectly in. The room had a tv, though the reception on some channels was bad. The service was also great and considering how cheap it was, service really didn't need to be anything special, but it was good to see the staff go out of their way for the customers. Some things were missing (we only got half a roll of toilet paper, no tissues, no tea or coffee, no shampoo or soap) but considering how cheap and close to the airport it is, I'm not surprised that some services were missing. Breakfast was also served, but I had an early flight and it wasn't open when I check out, but it shares a carpark with Krispy Kreme donuts and is right next to a Macca's and KFC. The best aspect of the hotel was how close it was to the airport, walking distance to domestic terminal and 2-3 min drive to international. Considering I lived 3 hours away from the airport when I stayed, paying $112 for a room less than 5 mins from the international airport (considering I'd already spend thousands on the holiday) the Formule 1 is perfect airport hotel to stay at. They also offer a shuttle to the international terminal, which was $6 a person. To conclude, the Formule 1 is not the best or most up market hotel I've ever stayed at, but the price/value is amazing for the location, just expect a cheap, basic room, nothing more. It's still the perfect place to stay before flying out of Sydney, or whilst in transit; however, the bed, in my room at least, was pretty bad and needed urgent replacing.

Reviews.Title: “Very Handy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before. A great hotel for an over night stay in transit via the airport terminal 2. 1 minute walk to fast food outlets. 10 minutes easy walk to T2. A little expensive for what you get though. Rooms are very basic but spacious and comfortable. Vending machines are reasonably priced. There is a bar and you can take drinks to your room. Easy on line booking and hassle-free check-in and check-out procedures. Staff are friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel for the budget conscious traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Absoultely the closest hotel to the airport - welcoming rooms.”
Reviews.Author: SimBrisbane
Reviews.Content: This would without doubt be the closest hotel to the airport. Just a few minutes walk. Right next door you have Dunkin Donuts, Mc Donald, KFC. All very new looking and nice. Plenty of parking at the hotel for a very small $8 per night. We walked to the airport in a few minutes to catch the train (which is down one escalator-so easy) to the Opera House...took about 20 mins. No train changes etc. The rooms were welcoming and bright, plenty of light, but with very good blinds that block all sun for a good sleep in. They were clean and comfy, a tad small for me, but I had also just come from a rather large room out of town. I would absolutey stay here again and get rid of the hire car which I did not need after arriving here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Wow, the closest hotel to the airport and great service. The man on reception, without being asked offered to find us a quite room and a very early checkin so that we could get some much needed rest before we hit the road for our very busy day in Sydney. That was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “10+ For the service from Gautam [Receptiondesk]”
Reviews.Author: Jeveline D
Reviews.Content: I give Gautam from the reception a 10 plus for all the help and answers that they gave me all day [for me was it night in the Netherlands]. For us in Holland was it a heavy night becuase the plane from Amsterdam arrived more than one houre later as expected, so we must arrange everthing in Singapore to let someone there pick up my dad and bring him to the next plane in 30 min. to fly from there to Syndey Each mail that i wrote with questions, and asking to let the room to be hold, they gave me a soon replay and nothing was too much. We even received a mail that my dad was arrived in the hotel! So that's why i give Gautam a 10+ for all the help! Thanks Gautam!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mother plus 3 children”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Loved the location to Airport, especially seeing I was traveling with three children on my own and flying out at 6.00a.m. There is a large variety of meal options in the locality and the Service was above and beyond. Very Happy, with all aspects of our stay. Was worried about noise, being so close to the Airport, though you would never have known.

Reviews.Title: “Mascot Formule 1”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice at Macsot's Formule 1 within three weeks. The reason for choosing this hotel over others was value for money and convenience. The location near the airport is extremely close as well as Krispy Kremes. McDonalds and KFC. Rooms are basic but adequate. Staff very friendly and helpful. thanks...

Reviews.Title: “Okay place to bunk for the night, not much more”
Reviews.Author: SamOntario
Reviews.Content: We stayed there because we had an early flight overseas and were coming from Canberra. Very very basic accommodation. More hostel like than I expected. Bring your own shampoo for example. Very old television. Internet access only in lobby. We had a view if the glowing lights of an American chain of donut shops! It worked and it was cheap but I probably won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “pay for what you get”
Reviews.Author: travelbyben
Reviews.Content: you pay for what you get at macot aiport. its cheap but near the airport. shuttle bus to international airport is 3.50 . so the tv is small and the shower a bit cosy but its half the price of anywhere esle close to maccas and the doughnut plavce for cheap snack just sleep and go

Reviews.Title: “Basic - but good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: lucybrees
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a very long flight from London and although it is extremely basic - it has got everything you need. No disturbance from the airport and got a very good night's sleep! We did venture to the centre of Sydney from here by bus - it was a bit of a walk to get to the bus stop but we managed it and the Reception staff were very helpful. Mcdonalds right next door too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Kudur
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at formula1 , in Canberra,two nights in Melbourne , all ready booked for six nights in Sydney ,for the money I am paying at this hotels is worth to the last cent, the money I have saved I spent it on my family.formula 1 is best when you are out exploring cities, and you come to the room to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Execellant quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Execellant quality for the price. Have stayed at this locate a number of times and always found it to be clean and tidy. Location is fantastic for access to the airport. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone needing accommodation whilst flying domesticly.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The carpet was filthy Minimal bedding Pathetic excuse for a tv Took ages to get pay tv No information in the room about what is available Disgusting bathroom Slightly cheaper than other hotels, but the worst standard I have ever seen

Reviews.Title: “A good night's sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We wanted a motel near to Mascot and found that Formule 1 was exactly in the area. It is accessible, staff at the desk were very helpful, and our room key was ready for us. The room was spotless and had all we needed. And to cap it off, we slept extremely well. We'll be very happy to recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at Formule i”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Missing are a power point in the bathroom to allow electric shaver, and a reading light that can be switched on and off from the bed. Spartan accommodation is OK, but that's just rubbing it in. Additional capital cost per room at time of building would be negligible

Reviews.Title: “Very basic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sarah14387
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights before flying back to London. Staff were friendly and helpful. Location is good, although costs around 16-20 dollars in a taxi from the International airport, although the hotel does do a shuttle service during certain hours. The Domestic airport is within walking distance, so I walked here to catch a train to the city. There is also a Krispy Creme, Macdonalds and KFC nearby, which is handy. And if you don't want to pay for the hotel WiFi, you can pop along to Macdonalds to use it for free! The room was very basic, and not that comfortable. Bed was very hard and creaked really loudly, and the bed really could have done with some brakes - it was very easily moved! Bathroom was fully functioning but small and when you shower, everything in there gets soaked! Television was a nice extra though - most channels worked. I think this place is ok just to sleep (although very noisy), but that's it - it's also quite overpriced for what you get. Probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My view”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: rooms good, I would like to see tea/coffee in the rooms and a kettle it would help to save conjestion in the lobby and kitchenette and would also save people going out late at night for a hot drink. Mothers with babies with a kettle in the room they can heat the babies bottles and the elderly who are at times frighten at going out late at night . I have never had a problem with the service always ready to help. The rooms have always been clean and tidy. Location is great for myself especially when flying in late and have an early morning flight out no taxi fares as the hotel is within walking distances to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but all you need is a good bed”
Reviews.Author: pimvandenberg
Reviews.Content: Formula 1 was meant to be cheap and basic accommodation. So is this hotel. But what else do you need after a 14 hours or longer flight from Europe to Australia than a good bed ?. And that's what you get. Breakfast can be had in the hotel but one minute on the lef when leaving the hotel it's a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great convenience right by the airport. Warning - no tea or coffee facilities in the rooms and they are basic, but very clean and very friendly and helpful staff. In fact I was really impressed by the level of service from staff given the cost of a room, service paralleled that in much higher star rating hotels. Ideal for an overnight when connecting to flights.

Reviews.Title: “Airport gateway”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful, room was as expected - budget but adequate. Extra towel was available to suit our numbers. Located close to airport but tricky to get to international terminal by car. Good breakfast in house, also close to Macca's and KFC.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at formule 1”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The motel is a fantastic place to stay before going on a flight from Sydney. Only complaint is there are no face washers. The customer service representatives were very friendly and most helpful. The room was a good size for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Stay”
Reviews.Author: bbcampbell
Reviews.Content: We were only staying one night before our international flight. We walked to the Hotel from Sydney Airport to also save $ and it was only a short walk. For the price we stayed we expected the worst but we were very pleased with the hotel. It is very clean, secure and in a nice location. Next door to fast food and the hotel offered a continental breakfast. There was even a TV in the room. We would definitely use the Hotel again for a budget short stay. It was basic but the price reflects the cleanliness and security of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stop over hotel - easy location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Formule 1 while in transit. Upon arrival at the hotel at 11pm the front desk staff were very helpful with prompt service. Although the rooms are small, they are very clean, and contain everything you need to a comfortable nights sleep. THe proximity of the hotel to the airport means what during the day you could walk to/from the airport if you wanted, and having fast food right next door was a godsend! I will definitely be staying at the Formule 1 next time I stop over in Sydney, and have already recommended it to friends

Reviews.Title: “Really Good”
Reviews.Author: Aidan M
Reviews.Content: With the cost of 109 for three people it's hard to do worse. Right next to the airport, quick check in, clean room and friendly people on the desk. Only drawbacks, The internet is REALLY slow (Don't bother) and the windows don't open. Also, the top bunk didn't have a full length matress, but we made do and it was fine for a one night stay,

Reviews.Title: “overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just what we needed for an overnight stay.It was clean had a tv was close to food outlets and close to the airport with a shuttle to get us to the international terminal in plenty of time for our flight.The cost was reasonable for the night,but the most important thing to us was the convenience of the hotel to the airport.We were happy with it and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HolidayLover053 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Bed comfortable, very close to airport. Very basic though, but we were just there for 1 night so it didn't bother us. There is an airport shuttle available, but it is NOT free. I thought the rate could have been better as it is a basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nothing flash, but a great value clean hotel right neat the airport. Great for those in transit. Staff are very nice and helpful. Highly recommend. Right next door is a Krispy Creme Donuts, KFC and McDonalds if that is your thing.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The unfortunate location of this hotel being next to fast food takeaway complexes, means sleeping is somewhat of a lucky dip. Late night hoon noise, a direct overhead flightpath from the domestic airport and rock hard bed left me tired and lacking vim in the morning. If sleep is something you can do without, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “easy to get to, and good for the budget conscious traveller”
Reviews.Author: sydneyadmiral Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: having an early morning flight out of Sydney, decided to try this Formule1 as it was the cheapest by far of the alternatives on offer (still cost $129.00). The room was acceptable for our 8 hour stay, and matched with leaving the car for the weekend at the nearby Park 'n' Fly made getting to our flight hassle free. Service problems? I rang and left a query, and my number on the answering machine - the call was not returned despite the message assuring me it would be. And even a budget hotel could keep the entrance area a bit neater and more inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Airport Value”
Reviews.Author: vee0ne Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well this was about our thirtieth stay at Airport Formule1 Sydney and as always good friendly service and great value considering the proximity to the domestic terminal.Although more expensive than other Formule1 Hotels still good value as not much else in the area for the budget minded people. The short walk from the Domestic terminal is ideal after a long international flight to stretch the legs and get them working again!! Prefer the bus connection to the International over the train as such a pain up and down stairs and lifts!! Or the shuttle option is also worthwhile. I like the newer section of the Hotel as it seems quieter than the older section. Short walk nextdoor for Maccas KFC or Krispy Cream or short walk back to domestic terminal for other food choices. All in all a good place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Could be improved”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Televisions need to be upgraded to reflect the current digital transmission & programming available in Sydney. Air conditioning was extremely noisey, although very efficient in cooling Possibly a hob or proper screen on showere to prevent flooding of complete bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: holidayloverAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Stayed as I had a very early flight. You could walk from the terminal if you dont have too much luggage. I took a taxi and then found out there is a shuttle service to it. Used the shuttle $6 back to terminal in morning. Mc Donalds, KFC and Krispy creme next door. Room basic but clean. Good if all you are after is a reasonably priced bed for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Airport and a Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: dwillmot Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you need an overnight stay close to the airport and don't need 5 star, then Formule 1 is ideal. We walked from the terminal, had a good nights sleep and had a very good experience. The check-in and check-out is quick (1 minute each for us). room / bed are basic but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel, or hostel? I think someone forgot the 'S' on the Website advertisement”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My stay at this establishment was for 1 night only and booked sight unseen on the internet for an overnight stopover between flights. However, it failed to reach my expectations. As a frerquent traveller I'm afraid a room with no more than a bed, 2 bunks, a 32cm portable analogue TV and an uncomfortable chair; with a foyer full of vending machines does not warrant description as an hotel or a 3 1/2 star rating no matter how big the building or reputation of the chain that owns it. I grant the room appeared to be clean despite the ants in the bathroom and the service was prompt and friendly at the counter where they accepted my credit card on arrival and swipe key/card on departure. Further than that, it served its purpose but I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room itself was very clean.The pillows were too flat for comfort, I would carry my own next time. The bed cover appeared stained/unwashed? It was very Quiet considering the location to the airport. The breakfast was not worth the money( Toast and cereal) as there are many food outlets across the road with a greater range. I would stay overnight again if i had to pick someone up early morning from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good Accomodation at a Budget Price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you need a quick stay when flying from Sydney Airport trhis is a real good bargin the only problems are that there is no wakeup service due to a lack of phones in the room and the bathroom floor floods when showering as trere is no lip on the shower and the floor does not seem to have a good enough fall to the outlet in the shower. The accomodation was quiet especially as it it is next door to the Airport and allows for a good nights sleep. It can be difficult if you set the alarm incorrectly. or forget to switch it on.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very central to flights, etc. Staff very helpful. I have stayed in other Formule 1 hotels and this would have to be best so far. My stay was only overnight so my use of any facilities was on a "crash pad" basis, but the fact that it was so close to things was a major factor in my choosing to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The site is very convenient for the airport, however the comfort of the bed was not as good as it could be. Additional pillows would help, also the bed needs to be able to be locked in place, if sitting up reading, the bed moves away from the wall, very disconcerting. Otherwise OK

Reviews.Title: “Handy overnight accommodation”
Reviews.Author: HOOKED ON FIJI Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have used this hotel many times before flying out or after flying in to Sydney when unable to make a same day connection to 'home'. Handy to Take away food outlets.Shuttle bus service a plus. Small but adequate accommodation for overnight stay is clean and beds comfortable, light breakfast available..

Reviews.Title: “My Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a place of convenienec. The rate tends to reflect the location and not the level of service. Not the place if your looking for pampering or service however the rooms are clean and appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Transit Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms basic with small TV, but able to watch World Cup Rugby on ground floor lounge large screen TV. Great location and value for money. Transfer organised to International Terminal at fair price. Very well soundproofed from outside, absolutely no external airport noise. Good parking immediately adjacent. Good fast food sevices within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Matt1972SnowLover
Reviews.Content: Very good location, but the beds are terrible. For a business that relies on selling beds, they are disgraceful. We tried the ibis, which thier beds are no better. If you want a decent sleep go a few dollars more to The Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good, except for the fact there was no mention of a cost for parking during the booking online and found we had to pay for parking when we got down there, just like to be aware of these things before travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very basic and OK for a one night stay. Staff is great and the location is fine for short airport stays. Would be nice to have a phone in the room and possible wake up calls to ensure you make your early flights.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you need some where to stay for a night.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was very small it was no good if we had the children, the shower flooded the bathroom floor and it was quite dangerouse when you walked into the bathroom I would not stay there again. Better shower filsilities would be better

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff were fantastic, location awesome, made our trip to the airport for our flight very easy, BUT would not recommend the rooms, very very small for three people, the showers were very frustrating with water spilling all over the floor and as for the TV we have never seen such a small TV, the saying you get what you pay for sticks in our mind for this motel...so unfortunately we would never stay again...

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Airport Formule 1”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located close to Sydney Domestic Airport and the shuttle bus service is great. There is no designated bus just for Formule 1 so ask any mini bus driver if he goes there - most do. Hotel comfortable and clean and staff cheerful and friendly. However, the aircon in the room does not get cool enough even in winter to give a comfortable sleep and I tossed and turned most of the night and thus started my travelling more tired than I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Easy & convienent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Was the closest place to stay nearest the airport, stayed there a number of times, this time one hick up the toilet didnt flush...mentioned it to reception nothing done, ow Ill let them know...besides this was ok ...I would never do more then a one night stay....its just nice and convineant

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: By_Cy
Reviews.Content: This must be the cleanest and most professionals of all the Formule 1s in town. The staff are pleasant, the lobby is neat and tidy and the mini-restaurant area is fresh and inviting. Daily newspapers really help, too. I actually stayed for a 4 nights at this hotel so I was no short-stayer. I must say, the continental breakfasts were quite tasty. Adequate and tasty. The room itself was not very big (as with all Formule 1) but again, it was adequate for our purposes. Lighting could be improved (was dim at times) but on the whole, the place is clean and an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A good budget option if you have to stay near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Princessfromoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night before flying out from the international terminal the next day. It was just as expected. Clean, tidy and basic. I would only recommend this if you are in transit and just need a bed for the night. The staff were very friendly although there was a bit of a wait to check in. Parking is not included in your room rate, so remember to add that on when you are doing your budget. The room was as expected, a comfortable bed. Clean but basic and small bathroom (one of those pre-fab type set ups). My only major complaint was the paper thin walls and very noisy neighbours which made for a not so great sleep. Bring ear plugs if you value your sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed but too tired to care at the time.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: cheap rate, basic room. 3 beds but only 2 towels. The two words that keep coming to mind are Cheap and basic........very basic. As the title says, we arrived on a late night flight because of industrial action at the airport so we were too tired to care at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Theb Jail”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Formule1 Sydney airport is exactly what I require - walking distance to the airport, value for money, sharp service. However I cannot help but think I am entering a jail when ever I stay there, not that I have spent any time in those institutions, but it is the feeling I get and it effects my energy levels. anything that could make it more "homely" would be a big plus. regards Brian PS beds on wheels are the pits, I can understand how handy it is for room servicing but can we not lock the wheels so it does not move around the room when you try to sit on it?

Reviews.Title: “Early Flight”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For me living 2 hrs from the airport and having to catch an early flight staying here makes good sense, I found the staff very helpfull, it's a little noisy with so much going on around but bearable. I like that if only away for a day or 2 I can leave my car there, I happy to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “its ok!”
Reviews.Author: scott_nz1
Reviews.Content: AUD $109 a night, ouch. But a 10 min easy walk from the domestic terminal. not signposted, but google maps will get you on your way. easy checkin. dunkin donuts, mcdonalds and kfc next door, so no problem getting a feed. there is a $6 shuttle to the international terminal but leaves at 5am, so no good if you have a 6am flight. as i had a 7am flight, 5am shuttle wasn't quite early enough. taxi is $18 flat rate, dunno if this is 'allowed' or should be on the meter, but I didn't bother to ask, got a free morning newspaper from the driver, nice. bed was comfy, shower was hot, soap was small but adequate. roller curtain blocked 100% of the light from dunkin donuts carpark. room had a clock radio and TV, very basic but ok. would i stay here again or stay in the city and train in? I dunno, depends on the price, but id stay here again probably.

Reviews.Title: “great for travellers”
Reviews.Author: dotcrom
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling in or out of Sydney airport this hotel is cheap, clean and comfortable. I'd rather save my money for the trip and thishotel often allows me to do that. The staff are helpful and its 5 mnutes walk from the domestic terminal and $6 shuttle bus ti international.

Reviews.Title: “Formulae 1 Sydney Airport Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was my second experience of Formula 1 Hotels, and it was an overall very positive experience and value for money. It was perfectly located, enabling us to walk to and from the nearby Sydney airport. The rooms were nice and fresh and clean, allowing for a comfortable stay. I would be very happy to stay in a Formula 1 Hotel again, and would certainly recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: chang8888
Reviews.Content: We had to fly very early in the morning so we got 2 rooms in the Formula 1 near Sydney airport. It was a very good rate near the airport and near various takeaway food outlet.Free parking and clean and well looked after units

Reviews.Title: “Rooms met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Needed a room for overnight stay next to airport. Rooms were clean, small, but comfortable. Great service. Had A/C problem and upon notification, staff quickly responded by relocating my luggage to another room while visiting city. Location is convienient. Being next to airport, I was able to walk with luggage from SYD domestic. However, access is difficult at night because the airport can get very busy. Road between airport and hotel is not pedestrian friendly, cars drive fast and there are several blind spots during 15 min walk, so please use caution and cross street at intersection next to DHL building. Contental breakfast was also $7 extra and satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, sufficent, over priced, Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Salsboy
Reviews.Content: Ideal for a night before an early flight, from Domestic terminal. Take a walk and recce the route, it is within three minutes walk, once you know the route. Quick reception, room clean but very basic, no tea or coffee facitities in room, TV and towels OK. Quick checkout. Quiet room and air con. Shower is a wet room, but OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: greggie85 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We used tihs hotel as a crash pad afrer our late arrival from overseas to rest up before travelling home the next day. The hotel is very unpretentious but great value if all you want to do is crash near the airport. They provide overnight parking for a moderate cost and there are fast food outlets nearby if you need a quick bite.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible&horrible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: They asked me a feedback for our stay at Formula one, please see my below response. This is the worst stay that I have ever had! Actually I didn't even stay there at that night, had to leave around midnight and went to IBIS near the airport and paid $187 for 5 hours stay! Anyway, the sheets were not very clean, had a bad smell, as soon as we get into bed, me and my partner started to scratch...The bathroom was was another story, I still can not believe there was no shower sink, there was no shampoo provided. The towels were old and were not smelling good. I paid $109 for this room, if this room was $50 I can understand but for $110 there is no value! also we didn't feel very secure as soon as we walked into the building, the reception looked careless while we were leaving, people were drinking a case of beer in front of the main entrance at 6am (we went back there to pick up our bags). There were many people walking around all night. At the end of the day this place is seriously damaging the brand image of accor hotels. I was very sure after I made the purchase that it will be a good choice since it is part of the accor hotels, can not be too bad. I knew that this is the budget accommodation but these conditions are not acceptable. I strongly recommend the senior management to audit this hotel, this place needs to be re-structured. Great location, shouldn't be like this. Is this your best?? Regards, Inan Gokyer

Reviews.Title: “Does for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Bad_Seed4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a long flight because we didn't want to risk making the long drive home being jetlagged. The hotel is very basic but does the job albeit at high Sydney prices. We had the same complaints as others about the shower but the room was clean and the hotel was quiet. Unfortunately, because the hotel is not clearly sign posted from the airport, we overshot the turn off and once you miss it there are no more turn offs so we did an illegal uturn and were booked by the police so it ended up being a very expensive stay. Our fault yes, but better signposting at the right turn off the main road would help.

Reviews.Title: “met my expectation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For what i paid it met my expectations. great location, only one complaint that the bathroom was a little too small for my liking, however overall great value. will stay again without doubt.internet access, breakfast good value, and the shuttle to the airport was fantastic, however can walk to the domestic easily in ten minutes.The parking fees for your car was quite reasonable.ie $15 for the 1st day then $ 8 for each day thereafter up to 7 days. Beats paying $52 per day in the airport carpark. staff were helpful as i said will stay again without doubt. thank you formule 1 john

Reviews.Title: “Functional, neat, no frills, but fine”
Reviews.Author: jeffm123
Reviews.Content: Had one night here to collect a friend at the airport very early one morning. Got a reasonable rate on line ($99). Had not stayed at this type of hotel before. Having prepaid, check-in was quick - just handed the key. Room was top floor. Rooms are not big, just featuring bed (queen - and a very firm but comfortable bed too - better than the Holiday Inn I stayed at nearby on a previous occasion). Bathroom is rather small and there is only a shower curtain rather than screen. No toiletries other than soap so BYO. Flat screen TV on the wall and a small desk and one chair were the only other things in the room. Hotel is next to a Krispy Kreme, MacDonalds (note - free wifi) and a KFC - so dining choices are limied. They charge $6 for parking in the car park and serve yourself breakfast is $8.00. Choices are cereal, toasts, some fruit, and yoghurt and tea/coffee, juice. All in all OK - room was clean, no fuss and not much noise from the airport. Would stay again for an overnight trip arriving or getting off a flight.

Reviews.Title: “totally disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I arrived late at night. The front desk was very disorganized. Got to my room and the first thing I saw was ants crawling up the wall. There were no washcloths, no hand towels, no bedside tables,one bar of soap the size of a half dollar and about as thick. They charged $100 which was way overpriced. I stay at Marriotts when at all possible and don't pay that much. Never stay at an accord hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Boy#7
Reviews.Content: As we had a 10am flight we decided to stay close to the airport so we didn’t have to fight through traffic that morning, and we couldn’t be happier. Yes the rooms are small and the bathrooms are tiny but it’s clean and very handy location only being a 10min walk away from the domestic terminal. McDonalds, KFC were located next door which was great for a quick bite for dinner, and krispy Kreme next door to grab a coffee before heading off to the airport that morning. As it was pouring with rain that morning we decided not to walk to the terminal as we planned, so we paid $6 each to take the airport shuttle which we thought was a reasonable cost, even tho its a short distance. I would return if I ever have a flight out of Sydney again (I don’t think you would want to stay any longer than 1 night)

Reviews.Title: “Simple. Neat. Clean. Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: AussieJD
Reviews.Content: Neat. Simple. Krispy Kream, maccas and KFC next door. Over the counter beer and wine. Breakfast available. Shuttle or 10 min walk to Terminal 2. All up, perfect for an early flight the next day!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot next to the airport!!”
Reviews.Author: amsfromaus Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For that night before an early morning flight, you can't ask for a better hotel! It's clean, convenient and comfortable, right next to Sydney International Airport! The new breakfast setup is great too!

Reviews.Title: “More of a Hostel Than a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: There were three false fire alarms during my one night stay. One persisted long enough that the manager had to make an announcement that it was a false alarm and guests should not be worried. Two went off and were quickly squelched, but only after awakening me from my sleep. Pay another $16 and stay at a 3-star option.

Reviews.Title: “convinience as it was with in walking distance of the airport”
Reviews.Author: Deniska77
Reviews.Content: Like most Forumle 1, it is simple and provides a good place to crash overnight. Walking distance from the domestic terminal makes this quite useful - you can literally carry your bags from the terminal to the hotel without too much fuss. The staff will provide information on local transport options as well. For the quick overnight type of hotel, it's not the cheapest. Sleep n' Go offers the same type of hotel but a little cheaper. Definitely check around for budget/chain hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Off to Thailand”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to stay in if you have an early flight. Close to airport, McDonalds, Krispy Creme and KFC all close by. Rooms are basic but clean and counter staff were always helpful. A bathmat would come in handy as bathroom floor gets very wet. I was amazed how quiet it was in the Hotel considering its close location to the airport. Would be more than happy to stay there again if I had to be at the airport for a morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Formule 1 Airport Motel was a very convenient stop before our international flight. Have stayed there previously and will do again. The service was pleasant and the rooms clean and comfortable. Location and price were very compatible with surrounding motels.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Airport Hotel - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Kengkla
Reviews.Content: As the room in Sydney area is continuously increasing from time to time, I found that this hotel has quite good value for money. With around AUD 100, you get a very basic clean room just for transit night sleeping. Parking is free, and there are Mcdonald and Krispy Kreme next door. It is only about 10 mins walk to domestic terminal, so dont take a rip off 2 mins shuttle, if you can walk there.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: annon70
Reviews.Content: What a horrible nights stay. Had to make our own bed. had 2 blankets between 3 beds. The heating was so noisy that had to turn it off which made our room so cold we all froze. All we could hear was doors slamming all night. My child ended up with bits all over her body from what we think was bed bugs. No tea/coffee making facilities in room. Having a shower was a nightmare as the toilet seat got soaking wet when the shower was running. We had 1 tiny little soap between the lot of us. Having 2 towels between 3 people was not great. Dont expect 5 star accommodation for a cheap price, but for $129 a night we expected to be at least warm and comfortable. It was so bad that we got up at 4.30am to go over to McDonalds to get a warm cuppa and be in somewhere at least clean. The walls had dirty marks all over them. We have stayed in budget accommodation at other locations and they were fine but this was one big nightmare. I would not advise anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “not a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We spent over an hour outside waiting for the shuttle to come, and it never did. We then went back inside and ended up taking a taxi that cost $23 for 7 km. Upon arrival, the person at the check in desk was very nice and advised us to visit the main street in the area which was nice. The room was tiny and not well kept. the walls had holes and scraps all over them. There was no shower, just a drain in the middle of the bathroom with a curtain and mold in the corners. The bed was hard. We were very displeased with our stay, it was certainly NOT worth the $100 we paid.

Reviews.Title: “you really get what you pay for - not much”
Reviews.Author: Pederbunch
Reviews.Content: Should have known - cheap room, no sleep! The rooms are large and do fit families in well. The bathhroom is adequate and was clean. However you cannot go back into the bathroom after a shower as the water spills all the way to the door. Generally adequate - we booked this room as we had an early international flight the next day. All we wanted was sleep - not a fancy room, just sleep. However the walls and doors are so thin you can hear people in the next room very clearly and noise in the hallway horrendous! It is a very easy walk from the airport or there is a $6 shuttle if you don't want to walk. Staff were mostyly friendly - some smiled, others just looked bored.

Reviews.Title: “Just a lousy box to use before a flight”
Reviews.Author: GosfordMoo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times... and it is all fairly rubbish stuff. The room is a small box (could double as a prison module box) with stained carpet, a bed that is on wheels and moves about, situated below a bunk bed (be careful u don't bump your head when u get up!!). The room has electricity and heating/cooling and bathroom. All this for only $89! Clearly a rip-off, but what can you do..... Why do i stay here is it is such crap? because it is the cheapest option that is closest to the airport. I live about 2-3 hours from Sydney airport by train, so an early morning flight is made easier by being close to the airport. There is an airport transfer bus from the hotel that services both domestic and international terminals. it was about $5 i think. You can walk to the domestic terminal in 8-10 minutes with no difficulty

Reviews.Title: “Make no mistake, this is very, VERY basic, you get safe, clean place but not value for money”
Reviews.Author: DRMB
Reviews.Content: This is very, VERY basic accommodation. It is very "bare bones". You get nothing extra. NOTHING! It’s like the rooms were made of fibreglass in a factory, the carpet sprayed on together with paint, and trucked to the site then stacked up together. I imagine this is also like a prison cell but more colourful. Some things to note: It is quite a walk from the Sydney Airport domestic terminal, especially the domestic terminal train station, especially if it is raining. Suggestion is to walk to the Terminal (Terminal 2?) where Virgin is and stay on that side of the road (that is keep the parking station on your left) until the road curves to the left. Then take the cross road on the right and walk one block. Do not go towards the motel with the carpark on your right. You end up having to cross 6 lanes of busy road with no cross walk or pedestrian crossing. This was so dangerous that I back tracked to the carpark and crossed over to the Virgin terminal and started again. Added about 30 minutes to the walk. This is not a short walk if you have luggage (why else would you stay here?) and it took 30 minutes from the Virgin Terminal. Take your own food, there is nothing close by except Dunking Donuts! The TV is very small but it provides noise and a few channels. There is no phone in the room. The room has like a double bed with a 3rd bed over that, and they take up most of th room in the hotel. You get no amenities, maybe only a small bit soap the size of a matchbox, and a few paper cups from memory. The shower and toilet are so small, the toilet gets wet when you have a shower. However, it was very clean and provided shelter for a few hours while waiting for the next morning flights to start (on account Sydney airport is closed overnight because of a permanent curfew) Considering the deals on the internet eg on What If or Last Minute there are far FAR better value hotels in downtown, EG consider on the train line that goes from Sydney airport the Great Southern, easy walk from the Central Railway station, or the many hotels at that end of Sydney, or others near Pitt St which are easy walking distance from the Museum station or the St James station. They also have the advantage of many pubs, restaurants, eating places especially around Dixon Street. Consider this ONLY if you are in transit overnight between the Domestic and Int Terminals, or vice versa, and have your eyes wide open about what you are paying for

Reviews.Title: “Formula one nights stay”
Reviews.Author: travellerMerriwa Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Budget accommodation very good bed not too comfy pillows really bad maybe need better bllankets on bunks kids slept cold otherwise was quite good for budget. Great location!!!aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated hotel within walking distance of Domestic terminal,was able to book shuttle to take us to International Terminal. Lobby was a little small and crowded in morning. Room was basic but price was good.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer relations”
Reviews.Author: sunlover123_11
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter stayed here unexpectedly whilst on her way to us but stranded by the ash cloud. I tried to sort her payment and other details out over the phone from Canada. I found the reception staff to be very unhelpful and unsupportive. They made no acknowledgement of my obvious concern for my daughter and made me feel as if i was taking up too much of their time. There are also no telephones in the rooms so I was unable to speak directly with my daughter and no-one tried to help with a solution. My daughter had a miserable time there and was pleased to leave. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who needs help with sorting out any problems and would certainly never choose to stay there myself.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the room was too small and not enough towels, not enough undercover parking, not enough directions inside the building, no instructions from staff as to how the door key/card works, I know it is budget accommodation and not 5 star but the reception staff weren't very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before. very concenient for overnight stay.Rooms very basic but clean. Walkable distance to Dometic Terminal. No complaints. Close to fast food outlets for quick and easy food. Very quiet with no aircraft noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary_RR
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night before departing for two weeks in Japan. It was the most expensive hotel of my trip and definitely the worst. The words that come to mind are basic and sparse. Felt like I had been transported to Communist Russia. The one amenity was a cake of soap. I couldn't believe there were no facilities to make a cuppa. It served its purpose as somewhere to lay my head between flights, but I won't darken their doors again. Can't help comparing it to my cheapest hotel in Japan, where I paid the equivalent of around $52 and got a twin room with every amenity you can think of and a 3 room bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “OK to save money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service was efficient, but unhelpful and not friendly. Only 1 pillow each, had to stand in shower to use mirror, no hairdryer. Cannot complain about the cost, but will not use again Quite a long walk from Mascot station, not 5-10 minutes, as advertised.

Reviews.Title: “I Now KNow What It Would Be Like To Spend A Night In The Cells.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very much a case of getting what you pay for sorry. The room was basic with a capital B and not even any tea and coffee making facilities. I have never been in a prison but imagine it must be something like this. In future I would pay the extra and stay a bit further away form the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Dont expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Not what I would call a hotel. Just a room with a bed really no services to speak of, carpet was so grubby it could have applied for wildlife sanctuary status. But then again it was very cheap and right next door to the terminal, so you get what you (your employer) pays for.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: oxymoron2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to the airport and ideal for an early morning flight. It is hardly 10 minute drive to the airport. Also, it is convenient to reach the city with the train from the station closeby. The room was very basic and I would say a bit overpriced. However, all the airport hotels I have stayed are expensive. I would recommend this hotel if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: milo2009
Reviews.Content: Cheap, clean and near the airport. Not spectacular but good value.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap One Nighter”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was as expected for a cheaper hotel. Linen and room could've been a little cleaner. Suitable for a fly in fly out stay. Our room was near the lift and was a little noisy with late night comings and goings. But this is to be expected for an airport motel. Desk service was very fast.

Reviews.Title: “hotel of choice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: OK, so its not a resort complex but its got everything you need. I have stayed here a few times and have ALWAYS found it a good, clean, very convenient place to stay near the airport. If you're after a value for money hotel near the airport this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night.”
Reviews.Author: TerryEmu
Reviews.Content: OK for a airport hotel, the walk is more like ten minutes than five. Pay for WIFI and shuttle. Fast food outlets next door.

Reviews.Title: “All in all Good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The only thing I did not like is the bunk over head of the bed The room was warm and bed reasonably comfortable Close to airport and easy access to food Very easy to book through internet and very quick to book in All in all Good value

Reviews.Title: “Fade out”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had flown from Hawaii, and needed an inexpensive place to sleep off the jetlag....and before our next sector....did not know about the bus, paid $15.00 cab fare from the International terminal to Formule 1.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Minimal, Cheap and Modern!”
Reviews.Author: lemonbee
Reviews.Content: This is easily the best hotel we've stayed in while in NSW. It is a 5 minute walk from the domestic terminal to the hotel, so easy. My partner and I enjoyed the open floor shower, TV and view... all for $90 per night through hotelclub.com. Breakfast room is clean and social. Guests and staff were all quite friendly. McDonalds and Crispy Creme are right next door if you feel like gaining weight. The train ride from the airport to anywhere else in Sydney is expensive ($15 to the city) when compared to other routes, but you can save yourself money by walking to Mascot and catching a bus instead ($4). The only negative is that all the smokers stand at the entrance and creep everyone else out...

Reviews.Title: “Formula 1 sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and tidy, excellant staff service, very basic but thats all that is needed for an overnight stay. Happy customer. I would recommend this hotel for business stay overs, how ever rooms are too small for a family holidays. Very quite location even with the airport so close I didnt hear any planes at all.

Reviews.Title: “Room rate by no means correlate with quality offered”
Reviews.Author: OllieOlnie Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is by no means a negative review on the hotel itself; it's just that the room rate charged is not justified considering it is not a hotel per se - it is a motel, as simple as that. I knew perfectly that I signed up for a no-frills hotel, not unlike Motel 6 (but even the Motel 6's I had stayed at were far superior) . I didn't know anything about the F1 brand, but I trusted the Accor brand. I had an early morning flight so I wanted to stay very close to the airport. The location of the F1 at Mascot was great, and the "hotel" was relatively clean, but otherwise, it's just a "bare" room with a queen bed (and a bunk), smelly carpeting, and a toilet with shower and one small bar of soap (the whole bathroom will be wet after you take a shower no matter how careful you are because the shower area is literally a shower head separated from the toilet by a flimsy curtain). There wasn't even a hair dryer, which I consider the bare minimum, considering that I had paid a non-refundable, prepaid room only rate of A$109. It would have been perfectly all right if the rate was in the range of A$70-80 for the quality of the room, because that's the grade of the room, in my opinion. It's a pricing problem, mostly. The front desk was fine, check-in procedures were fast, and my general questions asked without a fuss. It was Accor service I had expected. Again, it's just a pricing problem.

Reviews.Title: “domestic airport”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very close - walking distance to domestic - car parking at hotel - very handy - we will use again - but would probably not consider if using the international terminal as this is on the other side of the airfield and needs a shuttle bus to get there

Reviews.Title: “Simons Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay near the domestic and international airports. I was there to collect family arriving early from overseas so the location is ideal as I know I can be at the airport in just a few minutes. The motel room is spartan but has everything for a single night's stay. Especially appreciate the low cost breakfast and internet cafe as well.

Reviews.Title: “Formula one, Sydney airport”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel a little hard to find walking from the airport...directions on the website weren't neccessarily very helpful. Room was small but clean. Amenities were good. Little bit of an issue with noise level from guests on the same floor. Generally good for the amount paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for overnight stays.2 adults 2 kids slept well.QUIET!!”
Reviews.Author: DOOMSDAYER
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight.Rooms a little run down but clean.Rooms quiet with double glazed glass. One double bed and a double bunk.Aircon great. Rooms small with ensuite but functional. Great location and great cheap rate.Beds comfortable enough. For overnight stays perfect.MacDonalds next door and Crusty creme donuts.Great for brekky or dinner.Forget going to the fancy more expensive places. On site car parking $8.00 overnight.Simple breakfast available but we did not try otherwise snack machines for cravings. Aired room for a while as was stale. Can walk from Qantas domestic terminal. Free WI fi at Maccas!!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean, queen and single bed, large desk, view of airport and large bathroom”
Reviews.Author: maypip
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the mascot formula 1 hotel as we had an early flight to nz. The room was plenty big enough for mother and daughter with 2 big suitcases. There was a large desk and chair with a queen size bed and large single with a bathroom with a large shower and shower curtain and not the usual small cubicals, so plenty of room. Also we had a shuttle bus pick us up at 6am for transfers to the international airport. The room was very clean and roomy and will definitely stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money for a stopover stay”
Reviews.Author: jigarNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and found it to be very handy to domestic airport and the room, while compact, was very clean and tidy. I could not find the twin bed option on the net but one call to the hotel and it was all arranged. While there was no tea/coffee making in the room there was a cafe right next door and what was best of all was that the room was relatively quiet due to double glazing, not always an option next to a busy airport. For the price paid this was very good for our one night stay

Reviews.Title: “Good for 1 night between flights”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the proximity with the airport, but when I realized CBD is actually only a few minutes away I wonder if it was the best choice. Its a good hotel, but the internet access (which for me is one of the most important things in a hotel like this) was too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Stopover to catch early plane”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well-priced for the purpose of a bed and a shower and for staying overnight close to the airport. I walked to the domestic airport and also noticed there were transfer buses outside the hotel at 5.30 am when I left.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: LindaLong88 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I left my wallet at another hotel in Sydney. Adam got on the phone to the other hotel, located my wallet and it was hand delivered to the Hotel Formule 1, locked in a safe until I returned a week later. None of my money or credit cards etc. were used. I was very impressed with the help I received from the hotel staff. Having said that, it is a bear bones hotel to stay in, just a bed. Everything was clean and the staff was wonderful. We used the storage lockers to store luggage for a week at a total fee of $6.00. When I needed a hair dryer one was provided by the hotel. Our needs were met for an inexpensive one night stay at the airport. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not bother staying here again”
Reviews.Author: Madjude
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at this hotel due to the closeness of the airport. Stayed one night and that was long enough. The rooms are tiny with no room to move. We ate at the Mcdonalds next door to the hotel. I would not bother with the so called continental breakfast. It is $7 per head and is a self serve buffet style of basic cereals etc. Did not look appealing to me. Staff are not overly friendly and you definitely feel like you are staying in a "cattle class" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place is the pits!!!”
Reviews.Author: Makere
Reviews.Content: Be warned this place is a complete dump & waste of time and money!! We stayed in room 629 on Saturday 19th March when it was pouring with rain - not only outside, but inside too. The rain poured thru the supposedly sealed windows and straight into our suitcases, soaking everything. We were not offerred an apology, refund or even another room. The room was filthy dirty to begin with and the staff unhelpful. The building should be condemned and the staff sent to a residential school for training!!

Reviews.Title: “Sydney airport hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Basic but overall good value for money. Quite sparse - breakfast minimal but ok. Had to pay for it. Within walking distance to domestic terminal but need transport to international terminal. Staff did not have local knowledge and taxi transport for the morning to the international terminal was quite late in arriving.

Reviews.Title: “good location for airport”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: room ok but bunk beds so not good for us with young children. clean, friendly. shower in wet bathroom and no bath.
