I dropeed the camper van off at Britz - about 20mins walk we walked to domestic terminal and got airport express in to centre for a drink in the city the night before we left - easy

Reviews.Title: “No frills location with clean and cheap rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: No frills hotel with simple basic service, good if you are just going to the airport and don't want to spend a fortune or get lost into Sydney traffic. Very quite location, literally beside the domestic terminal and really close to the international one.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute option”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had to find accommodation in the area at short notice and booked a discounted deal at the Formule 1 Sydney Airport. Was not advised that parking was an extra cost ($8.00). Room very basic as expected. Only negative is that the alarm clock is bolted to a panel under the TV and it is impossible to set the alarm without using a torch.

Reviews.Title: “New rooms are much nicer!”
Reviews.Author: Babybhen
Reviews.Content: This is perfect overnight stay if you have a morning flight in Sydney. I hope that everyone gets as lucky as we were when we had our room. We had the new room, which was way better than the old ones, i think. It was small but have enough space to walk, bathroom is clean, window is big but cannot open. Compared to their other branch in melbourne tullamarine airport, this is way way ahead in terms of service. If you can request for the new rooms, do so. You wouldnt regret it!

Reviews.Title: “quick stop”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Formula 1 hotel has a perfect location, for quick travellers. You can walk to the domestic terminal it takes only 10min. Hotel is clean and provides nice towels. Aircon works a bit noisy but you cant hear any outside noises which is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS NOT A FAKE REVIEW”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have already sent a email to accor . Good value but only received one pillow each which was as flat as a peice of cardboard. We folded our quilt up to put under pillows but was very hard. Sewerage smell was in the bathroom so we put the shower on and washed the strong odour away. Would also be nice to be able to get a morning call would pay a few dollars more for it..

Reviews.Title: “good stop over”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: bunk beds uncomfortable for older taller children, otherwise good for a quick stop over before flight

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient but remember your ear-plugs”
Reviews.Author: Blessings-to-you Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay with an early morning flight the next day as the hotel has a $6 shuttle service. This is the 2nd time we've stayed (and the shuttle driver was grumpy both times!). Unfortunately noise was an issue...no not the planes overhead, but the very noisy family in the next room who, at 10pm at night were obviously so excited about their upcoming trip they didn't care how disruptive they were for the other guests on our floor. Pretty selfish.

Reviews.Title: “Stay before flying home”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel which offers good value for people who require easy access to the Airport. There are no frills but the beds were fine and the bathrrom was clean even if it was tiny. Krispy Kreme Donuts and McDonalds just next door so it was easy to get a quick breakfast. Less than 2 minutes to the airport whihc was great on the morning of our departure.

Reviews.Title: “adequate but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was a little spacre for one nights stay, no basic amenities such as a kettle, but as the last point before my flight home was adequate. Would have liked the option to keep the room until later in the afternoon as I then had to spend the day sitting in the airport waiting to check in for my evening flight. On a positive note the staff were helpful and friendly, and situated next to a mcdonalds and krisoy kreme was handy!

Reviews.Title: “Day rest”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and good value- Used the hotel for a few hours sleep between a long haul flight from London and a short haul flight to Brisbane,

Reviews.Title: “Drive-in and drive-out accomodation at Mascot”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was basic but comfortable. Queen size bed was comfortable and we slept better than expected. Convenient for us to get to the international airport by taxi and back again by shuttle bus. Staff were pleasant and helpful. We did not use the breakfast/food facilities but the hotel was convenient to a couple of fast food outlets which were adequate for the short term stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We landed very late in Sydney and stayed at the F1 out of convenience. There was still someone at the reception desk at nearly 10:30pm and we were served quickly and given all the information we needed. The rooms are clean and have enough space for the night. We skipped breakfast as it was $7 for toast and cereal, so we opted for the nearby McDonald's instead, but altogether the F1 was very reasonably priced, clean, and a good place to stay as a stopover. Also liked how the flight times are shown on a TV in reception - excellent place to stay if you're catching a flight the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was close to the airport Rooms were clean and had every thing you needed accept a bar fridge.

Reviews.Title: “airport overnight”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a no frills, low cost option for airport travellers. We checked in 8 pm in the evening and left by 8 am next day. Check in quick, had pre paid and all I had to do was collect the key, check out just as quick. Rooms were what we expected but with the bonus of being quiet with a good bed. Nothing to do in the hotel or immediate location but we expected that.

Reviews.Title: “my comments”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I think the showers could have been designed better as per the Homebush site as I think they are dangerouse when slippery. Beds are a little too hard and cushions could be bulkier. Other wise service is great and staff could be in a 5 star hotel with their courtesy. An example of how other sites should be within F1 chain.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at airport”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms are what i wanted for a good night sleep. Staff were good and assisted when asked. Enjoyed the stay

Reviews.Title: “Happy Formula”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was more then satisfied with room and bathroom size and how clean they both were for a formula one motel. I still fill that $97.00 is a lot to ask for a Accor Advantage Plus Member, a further 10% discount would encourage me to use the motel again when travelling out of Sydney airport.

Reviews.Title: “Family Room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a family room for 4. it was great value and close to the airport for our 6am flight. would highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed being close to the Domestic Terminal to meet friends arriving from the Gold Coast.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome respite for Air Travellers”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: After a long flight it was a welcome sight, especially when you have an early flight the next morning as the terminals are only minutes away. Just a stopover hotel only. Have nice cold beers for sale and Macca's is next door.

Reviews.Title: “New rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the formule1 twice recently. The new rooms are great for couples. They even have tiled bathrooms. Great value rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The room is what you pay for but the staff were really good”
Reviews.Author: ollie1982
Reviews.Content: Unexpectedly spent 2 nights in the hotel ather than the one that was booked due to our passports going missing. Tip always make sure the shuttle bus driver puts your luggage on together as one of our bags (that I put the travel wallet in including passports for the commute from hotel to terminal) was given to another family who decided not to take the bus and to catch a taxi instead. Sydney Super Shuttles you must make sure that the bags belong to the correct people!!!! Once the mistake was identified the hotel staff went out of their way to help me try to track down the bag. Unfortunately the bag ended up in Avalon!! The hotel quickly booked us back in as we ended up missing the flight. THe room itself though is exactly what you would expect - bed and shower. The rooms are perfect for those just wanting a bed. The shower however is in a very small bathroom so make sure that if you have anything in that bathroom it will get wet. This shower should be renamed a wet room as it is basically just a big shower with a loo next to it. The hotel is really well located for the domestic terminal, a little bit of a ride from the international though, but regular shuttle buses. Once again the shuttle bus drivers are rude and hide behind a language barrier when you have a problem. The hotel is also right next to a mcdonalds and doughnut shop so there is food options available. THe hotel is also about 15min walk from mascot station (about 10min walk from domestic station). This makes it easy to avoid a $10 airport surcharge to use the train to go into the city.

Reviews.Title: “location wins”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: highly recommended becauseof proximity to airport when making an early morning departure. This was the second time we have stayed in the past few months

Reviews.Title: “Overnite”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The formula 1 motel was located very conveniently to the airport and transport back abd forth. It was comfortable, quiet and clean. The staff on the front desk were welcoming and helpful. The staff met in the upstairs corridors were friendly in their greetings. The convenience of having breakfast before I left for the airport was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: CJCollins
Reviews.Content: the man working on the desk was very unhelpful. He had a poor command of English and wasn't able to provide us with dollar coins for the laundry - sent us up to the shops which were shut! After I had checked in he informed me that to park the car in the hotel car park it would incur an additional $15. The room was tiny with a curtain between the sink and the bed. The room was grubby. No local facilities, no tea making facilities. The price of the hotel doubles if there is a convention at the centre!!!

Reviews.Title: “Did the job perfectly”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For what you pay, and for the location, this hotel did the job perfectly. It was 100% clean, 100% functional and I will use the hotel again. I used the hotel's $7 breakfast, and although very simple, again, it did the job perfectly. The only thing that wasn't 100% for me was the room sound-proofing. I was woken up both mornings of my stay by people leaving their rooms and walking down the corridor. So with some seals around the room door, I'd have nothing to complain about! Highly recommended for a cheap, clean and convenient overnighter before travel or a business conference.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not so cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a fantastic position, right next to the airport which was great as we had a very early flight out - the outside walls were soundproof but the inside walls might as well have been made out of tissue paper. We were awake until 11pm with a party going on next door and then we were positioned right by the lift which made a "ding" every time the button was pressed and every time it landed on our floor - people were coming and going right through to 1am and then it started again at 3am as people were leaving.

Reviews.Title: “very happy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i know you would pay more we would have liked to make a cuppa in our room

Reviews.Title: “Handy location, nothing exceptional yet good value”
Reviews.Author: JohnsiesonHol
Reviews.Content: If you have a flight leaving from Sydney airport and require a bed for the night that is good value, then this is the place. I travelled to the NRL GF, and had an early'ish flight the next day. Wake up, quick shower, shuttle to the airport, grab coffee & breakfast at airport, catch your flight. No fuss. PROS Location, clean room, excellent value, shuttle bus service available to & from airport. CONS Not much to do nearby, basics only @ hotel. Advice Book the shuttle bus before you arrive ($6 one way, $12 return), or get a taxi to the hotel it's only a 5 min trip & book return shuttle from the hotel. Not much in the way of food close by (McDonalds & Krispy Kreme located next door). Ideal hotel if you need a one night stay close to the airport. Clean room ok bed. Nothing more nothing less.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and covenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kat307
Reviews.Content: I had a night stopover in Sydney between flights and I chose this hotel because it was really good value. It did exactly what I wanted it to do - provided me somewhere clean and comfortable to sleep for a few hours. The room was really nice and I slept very soundly. Also enjoyed watching some TV and a hot shower. Brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Great for price paid”
Reviews.Author: Traveler255060
Reviews.Content: We thought this place was great value for the price. It's nothing flash but when you pay $ 79 you know what it will be & we were suprised that our room had a Queen bed & bunks but room to mve around. Bathroom was small but again remember the price. It always amazes me when people pay a cheap price then expect top class facilities. You get what you pay for anyone complaining need to go up the road and pay $200+ and can then expect top class facilities. We live in Sydney but would use this motel again when we have a early flight out in the morning( we walked to the airport with our bags its very close to the airport)

Reviews.Title: “Good simple airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevenleeds
Reviews.Content: Simple, clean and you get what you pay for. You'd never stay here on a holiday its simply a place to sleep. Its very close to the airport ($8 for 2 people and 2 suitcases) and a 5 min walk to the bus stop that takes you right into the Sydney CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for its purpose!”
Reviews.Author: stokie_gem
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you just want to get to and from the airport, the prices are not exactly cheap but are some of the better rates for airport hotels! They offer a $6 per person shuttle to and from the hotel, make sure you use this as I can speak from experience that with the traffic a taxi works out more expensive if theres only 1 or 2 of you! Clean rooms with shower and toilet and TV, krispy kreme doughnuts and McDonalds within a stones a throw,

Reviews.Title: “mmmmm...”
Reviews.Author: Angelina_jNewcastle
Reviews.Content: PRO'S - Great location. So close to airport!!! - close to good restaurants - in mascot - friendly staff - cheap parking ($5) and not to forget Krispy Kremes! CONS: - Not a very good nights sleep. :( But maybe that was the fact i was going overseas the next day and was excited?? - Paper thin walls... - and not too clean.... since i have left i havent stopped scratching!! - Heres hoping its not lice :P But really, you wouldnt stay here unless your goin to the airport or a function near by. So theres no use complaining really, as its so close to the airport and was only for one night! I would stay here again for the airport situation!

Reviews.Title: “Not a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: adventureguyNZ
Reviews.Content: Hotel was cheap and close to the airport. The staff were pretty uninterested in anyting that was going on. The staiwell looked like it had several ashtrays tipped into it near the the bottom exit. Room was small and very basic. Could only just walk around the end of the bed. On a postive note it was very quiet with double glazzed windows. Best and cheapest hotel to stay at whilst passing through Sydney, far quieter than the some of the other options. Bed was comfey.

Reviews.Title: “Pays your money - takes your chance”
Reviews.Author: janeymcp
Reviews.Content: Its cheap - for a reason. If you want a cheap overnight airport stay this fits the bill but certainly does not aspire to be anything more than that. Room was 'basic'- imagine a prison cell with (worn out) carpet. Shower head fell off when we tried to use the shower. Only positive point is that you can walk to the Stamford hotel's bar for a nice pub meal (if you dont mind walking along the edge of the road)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Close to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: bellsy1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Formule 1 for one night prior to a morning flight. Chosen purely based on the fact it was the cheapest hotel close to the airport, I didn't expect anything fancy and my expectations were not surpassed. This was the first time I'd stayed in a Formule 1. The best comparison is to a private room in a hostel. It was clean, and contained a double bed with a single bunk bed over the top. The bed wasn't great – very very soft (= worn out), but we both slept fine. The room is small, and I'd imagine it would be pretty cramped if you had three people in the same room, but you don't come to a place like this to hang out in the room. It has a small desk and chair where you can set up a laptop or write, as well as a small TV. The bathroom is spartan, there is no set shower cubicle which is always annoying. It is just a curtain so the floor gets soaked after someone has their shower. There is also no place in the shower to sit your toiletries, forcing you to open and close the curtain to grab you stuff from the sink (further soaking the room). Check-in was problem free, as was check-out. The domestic terminal was approx. 5 minutes walk from the hotel. The walk isn't completely undercover so if it's raining catch a cab or one of the airport shuttles that comes to the hotel. We caught the shuttle from the hotel to the International Terminal ($6 per person) which left 10 minutes after the scheduled time (after telling us to get there 10 minutes prior to schedule, meaning we stood out front for over 20 minutes). Not the hotels fault by any means, just allow some extra time if you plan to use the shuttle. Overall it's fine for what it is – a bed and shower close to the airport. Nothing more, nothing less.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic and un-interesting place to stay”
Reviews.Author: IROC-Andy
Reviews.Content: Ideal location for the aiport but thats all this hotel has going for it. Its very basic, pretty grubby rooms and after a great holiday it was a depressing place to stay before our flight home. The lifts and fellow guests kept us awake, its a 24hr hotel reception and people were coming and going all night. That said its ideal for overnight at the airport and perfect if you have an early flight. Only a Donut shop and MacDonalds next door to eat in if your hungry. The transfer bus from the airport costs $6.00 each which can soon mount up with 5 in your family!

Reviews.Title: “Not So Great..”
Reviews.Author: beedoo747
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the recently added wing in a queen room. The worst things about this hotel are as follows - - Pillows with no substance whatsoever. You might as well try to sleep on some cotton wool. If at all possible, bring your own pillows or something you can use as a pillow. If not possible and you want a decent nights sleep but can't sleep well without a decent pillow, you might want to reconsider staying here. - The shower rooms. Who on earth designed these things! Water will get all over the floor when you shower and in some rooms will actually end up soaking the carpet of the room, too. You need to plan your shower for the very last moment and once you are done you will want to use your towel/s to cover the floor in case you need to use the toilet or the sink. You certainly do not want to shower before bed, because the floor in that room will be wet all night and you won't have towels for the morning unless you bring your own. - There are no toiletries provided other than a bar of soap, so plan accordingly and bring your own. - You may be able to hear the planes, depending of course on which runway they are using. The hotel is near to the flight path for one of the runways (the short one which is generally used by 737/airbus a320 type aircraft as well as lighter planes). However there is a curfew which I believe starts between somewhere between 10pm to midnight and 6am, so you will have at least 6 hours without any aircraft noise. The good things - - Right next door to Krispy Kreme and Mcdonalds, so if you need food or a sugar rush or coffee you do not have to walk very far. If you want something to eat other than Krispy Kreme or Maccas, you can go to terminal 2 and get a larger range of foods to choose from. Bear in mind you will need to clear airport security to access that food court in terminal 2. You could also go to terminal 3 but they do not have as large a range of food. - A fairly short walk to the domestic terminals - when I say short, you would probably want to be wearing comfortable shoes and not carrying too much. - The beds themselves are reasonably comfortable if only you have a decent pillow. Would I recommend this hotel to a friend? Only in certain circumstances - and I would make sure to tell them the above so they can make up their own mind. If I had to recommend a hotel airport and budget was an issue, this would be the one. If they did not mind spending a little bit more, I would recommend the nearby Stamford.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and value for money no frills”
Reviews.Author: raycrabb
Reviews.Content: Was surprised as this was a new building, had presumed the opposite from reading other reviews.Our room was on the 5th floor it was cramped but clean, a little bewildering have a bunk bed above your head, for one night stay this was acceptable but would not like to stay longer. Reception staff were very helpfull and keen to give advice, location was ideal for the airport and travelling to into Sydney. Value for money no frills, pay for broadband, breakfast and no room facilities for hot drinks. Advice use MacDonalds, building opposite for free wifi. Save money and catch the local bus into/out of Sydney, bus stop only ten minutes walk from the hotel,check with the reception for directions.

Reviews.Title: “Gloomy but handy”
Reviews.Author: semi-detached
Reviews.Content: This is the cheapest place we could find this close to the airport, but the trade-off is the rooms are cramped and depressing. If you arrive late and leave early - as we did - it's livable with. Reception is clean and modern but our room had a stained carpet, marked walls and a cigarette burn in the sheets. Low frills is fine but it's better to draw the line before grim! The reception staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast area is very clean and comfortable and breakfast looked good for $7. There are also vending machines and a good sized guest fridge. There are no coffee/tea making facilities in the room. Parking is $5 and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes”
Reviews.Author: ImpulseIX
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before, but this was the last time. Found a cockroach in my room. The room sprung a leak and almost killed my laptop and other stuff charging on the desk. Key card stopped working all the time. Got charged for a car park, when there was no mention on the website or on the entrance gate. For some reason the fee increases on the weekend from $5 to $12....

Reviews.Title: “Convenient as a stopover”
Reviews.Author: Blackcat2york
Reviews.Content: We used this for one night before a flight the next day. We chose to walk from the domestic arrivals but in the dark it isn't easy to find. We had to ask three people before we finally located it and realised that we should have turned right directly after exiting the doors. It does the job, a clean reasonably well equipped room for a cheap price. Shower room is attractively designed but water from the shower goes all over the floor everywhere. Surprisingly quiet for an airport location - must be good soundproofing. Breakfast a little disappointing as supplies of some thingas had run out and we had to press for them to be replaced. Staff generally friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “no longer a budget hotel. spend $10-$20 more, you may get a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanberraTourist
Reviews.Content: I used to be a Formule 1 motel fan (Sydney domestic airport was one of my favourite). Used to be cheap (the old days $79 per night for a family room, now $109). I feel that it is no longer budget motel (especially this price for a 2 star). If you are organised enough and book early, you can get a 4 to 4.5 star hotel in the airport region (or in the CBD) for just over $100 on Wotif or last minute secret hotels. Why did we stay here then? Well, unfortunately all the hotels in the CBD were booked out on the new years eve. The good things about this motel, it's clean though very basic (I hate the bathroom though, there is no separate shower and toilet.. the whole bathroom and toilet are wet after a shower. Parking is cheap at $5 per night. There's Crispin Cream Donut shop and now a new McDonalds just next door. If you have a family of 4 to 6 then it is a bargain. The service from the front desk is friendly. If you have an early fight (especially domestic, which is walking distance) then this is convenient. Will I stay here again? Well, if I can't find anywhere to stay, then I may be back again. This is not a place for a romantic stay.

Reviews.Title: “spartan, but fine for a cheap sleep by the airport”
Reviews.Author: RangeviewRay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night passing through Sydney with an early flight the next morning. Less than 10 minutes walk to/from the domestic terminal, or a $6 shuttle bus ride to domestic or international terminals. It's like the other Formule 1 hotels I've stayed in ... a very small very basic room with a double bed, a single bunk bed above it, and a small bathroom. There is no separate shower stall, just a curtain to keep the spray off the toilet and sink. Room wasn't spotless (the carpet needed a thorough cleaning) but we had no real complaint. Front desk staff were efficient, courteous, and helpful. There are 24-hour McDonalds and Krispy Kreme fast food restaurants next door. The Botany Road neighborhood in Mascot is about a 15-minute walk (safe area for walking) if you want some restaurant options in the evening; most seemed to close by 9:00 pm. The only real reason to stay here is if you want to stay very near the airport for only one night... but it's fine for that purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat location for early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: monica3774
Reviews.Content: The only reason you would stay here is if you have an early morning flight and it is perfect for that. A bed and shower and small tv is all you need. Only paid $79 for a double bed and bunk beds so easily sleeps 4. Bit of a hostel feel to it, but who cares if you just need a bed and shower. Room was quite clean and I was very suprised to find the bed to be quite comfortable! No oise from airport at all. Located near domestic terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but good”
Reviews.Author: JacentaL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is VERY close to the airport [about a 10 min walk] which is good if you just need an overnight stop, like I did. Even though it is quite close to the airport, I didn't hear one single plane fly overhead. The room was very basic, 2 beds, shower, toilet, colour TV and radio, and honestly I think that is all you need on a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “yay for people with an early flight”
Reviews.Author: Monimonica
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in July this year before my 6 o'clock flight out to SA. Was gonna sleep on the airport floor but was told that i could stay at this hotel for really cheap price. and we did. the standard price was AUD$99 but we booked online and got $49 - which was super cool for two. The room was not so big and the single bed was actually above the double. You need to climb up to it but for me it was kind of fun! Very basic and simple... but still we felt really happy we stayed there. The most important thing is.. it's close to the airport! so we could get up and walk there in minutes. And it was real clean and tidy so no need to worry about this. Our room was facing the highway but you could hear nothing from out there as the window was fully sealed. a bit light coming from outside at night but not too much a worry unless you are really sensitive.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money - easy walk to domestic terminals - basic ok”
Reviews.Author: prissywollongong
Reviews.Content: i have no idea what people expect from a hotel for aud99 within easy walking distance of sydney airports domestic terminals or travel by regular transfers to the international terminal etc. spotlessly clean, furbished on a basic but good quality style furnishings - brilliant value for money - extra good value for families - try staying at an airport hotel near london or new yorks various airports and see what you would pay!!! this hotel is styled to accommodate travellers for a decent nights rest - so it doesn't have a bar or sauna or a disco etc etc - people are getting far too greedy for my liking - pay for a two/three star hotel and expect a six star? not very likely. i travel a lot on business and i will stay at this hotel everytime i need to.

Reviews.Title: “complete rip off; do not stay here unless you are really desperate!”
Reviews.Author: theproo
Reviews.Content: This place is a complete rip off. There are much better, cheaper hotels in the city or for little more around the airport. We had to pay AUD119 plus parking for a room, which didn't even have a proper bathroom. There room was dingy with snot-like stains on the walls and the view to the tiny TV was partially obsured by the bunk bed we had in our 'family' room. The shower consisted of a curtain across a corner section and the whole place flooded when you took a shower. There were no tea/coffee making facilities but you could buy a cup of brew from the lobby at AUD2.50 a pop! There were not even any glasses for a drink of tap water. There was no fridge, only a communal fridge in the lobby, which nobody used for obvious reasons. I was so mad for not doing a bit of research beforehand and had to pay for this dump knowing I could get much better value elsewhere. I will never stay at any of these places ever again. I'd rather pay the extra to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal accommodation for a night prior to early departure for overseas”
Reviews.Author: BOP66
Reviews.Content: My only requirement was a bed close to the International Airport ans this was perfect. Will use again.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for explosing Sydney are with a rental car”
Reviews.Author: Bobbykat
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right outside the parameters of SYD airport. Across the parking lot is a Krispy Kreme doughnut place. Rooms were ok and tidy as well as bathrooms. Downstairs laundry room was easy to use as was the internet access downstairs. Taxi to Darling Harbour wasn't too expensive but it's easier to have a rental car if you're staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: Blaeu
Reviews.Content: This was the third hotel on our round the world trip, and was only a place to stay for the night before we flew out again. We didn't expect great things, and what we got was about what we expected. The hotel is pretty basic. The rooms have a double bed, with a single bed mounted above it. There is a small TV, and alarm clock and a small en-suite with a shower. There's no restaurant, but there are food machines and a microwave. There is also a MacDonalds and a Krispy Creme next to the hotel (although the McD's was closed when we were there for refurbishment). There is a shuttle bus to the airport, but you have to pay for it. Staff were friendly and helpful, even lending us a UK/Australian adaptor plug. The room sound proofing was surprisingly good considering it is right by the runway and a busy road. If you're looking for a good, clean and most importantly cheap place to stay for a night before your flight, this is for you. Just dont expect bells and whistles.

Reviews.Title: “Jail might be preferable”
Reviews.Author: Victorianlad
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is cheaper than others around Sydney Airport, it had the feel of a prison cell. A double bed and bunk bed plus a small table with chair were the only furnishings of note, with the television being screwed to the wall overhead. The prison-like atmosphere was further 'enhanced' by a double storey bulk bed at right angles to the main bed; a bathroom whose floor became wet everywhere, and loud conversation from the family next door that thankfully ceased about 2330. Tilt-slab concrete, modular construction may save on costs, but the whole hotel exuded a depressing atmosphere which is typical of many Accor Group properties, as I find Ibis Hotels to be little better.

Reviews.Title: “totally violating experience”
Reviews.Author: Desdaway
Reviews.Content: Obviously you would only stay here if you were waiting for a connecting flight but this "hotel" is rancid. We has a twin share room which was the size of a prison cell, the top bunk mattress didn't cover the length of the bed (about 2 foot short) and had small black curly hairs on the sheets (Wonder what they were!!). Bathroom is tiny and as soon as you have a shower you need another one because the room is so hot. The only place to get food is Krispy Kreme's unless you want vending mechine food. Spend the money and go else where as this hotel is violating

Reviews.Title: “I know what Jail feels like now!!!”
Reviews.Author: mamanurse
Reviews.Content: Imagine a tiny jail cell. That's it. No tv, no clock, no room for luggage, no nothing but a tiny lumpy bed that listed to the left - a hard left. The bathroom consists of toilet, sink and a shower - with no deliniation. Just a curtain and a drain in the floor. The best part of the stay was the check-out knowing I could leave. If you love dark, depressing and seriously basic to the point of being austere, this is the place for you!!!

Reviews.Title: “for the traveller in transit”
Reviews.Author: aferraro
Reviews.Content: booked on their web site, for $99 per night. Heading overseas, and spent the night in Sydney in transit. I have previously stayed at the Ibis in Mascot, which is a little more expensive. As per other reviews, the rooms are tiny. There are no cups or coffee facilities in the room, and no telephone. You can't open the window. That said, the room was sufficiently clean. We took the shuttle to the international terminal the next morning, bright and early at around 6am, for $5 per person. Apparently the shuttle runs every half hour between 5am and 10am to and from the international and domestic terminals. Just outside the hotel entrance you'll usually see a small crowd of people smoking their cigarettes. The hotel offers a cheap self serve continental breakfast, entailing a choice of cereals, milk, and toast. I think it was around $7.

Reviews.Title: “No frills - see Photos”
Reviews.Author: Mike873
Reviews.Content: Pros: Inexpensive, new, comfortable, euro-style hotel. Cons: Bare bones, no frills. No WiFi. No phone in room. No hair dryer. You can walk there from the DOMESTIC teminal in 10 mins, it is next to DHL. They also have a shuttle (at least during the day) to domestic and international terminals, $5. Parking out front of hotel. Rooms have TV and alarm clock, power outlets (240 volt). Coin-operated internet and pay phones near reception. Communal fridge and irons, pay-laundromat on ground floor. I did not hear any planes from the room. Rooms fairly small but adequate. Bathroom: soap, no shampoo. Breakfast $7. There is a krispy kreme next door. I paid $104 Aust. Best suited for someone wanting a place to crash before a flight the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of billboards from your basic room”
Reviews.Author: Pointybunny
Reviews.Content: Hotel Formule1 is convenient to the Sydney airport, however from the International airport it is either a 40 plus minute walk down busy motorways or a $5. per person shuttle to the Domestic airport. From the domestic airport the hotel is an additional 10 minute walk along side a busy motorway in the blazing sun. The hotel is placed ideally for noise. There is a freight train running regularly behind the building as well as a busy motorway, across the street you can find a DHL building, a 24 hour air ambulance and a small airfield. We were prepared for a thoroughly noisy evening. First off the Hotel staff was wonderful. Friendly, amazingly helpful and had great advice on area attractions. The lobby had a plethora of brochures and several area food delivery menus. There was an area with vending machines. One with chips, one with drinks, and one with a small selection of frozen meals of the Lean Cuisine type. The room itself was none to clean but tolerable as long as you didnt look to closely. There were clean sheets on the Queen Size bed and bunk beds. The Queen size bed was exciting in that it rolled all over the place. As well, there was a very small tv with remote that receives about 4 channels and pay per view movies. There is no phone but there is a pay phone in the lobby. There was one small window that opened to a fantastic view of a huge billboard. The bathroom was compact and had a very odd, not entirely pleasant smell. Amazingly none of the outside noise we had anticipated was present. It was very quiet. The hotel is situated in an area not suitable for walking so be prepared to take public transportation or rent a car. As a treat, there is a 24 hour Krispy Kreme next door. The hotel staff were able to give us plenty of information on transportation and things to do. We found out afterwards there is a shuttle that runs to the airport for $5. directly from the hotel. Everything was fine until the night, then all of a sudden the Hotel Formule1 became party central. There were people drinking, yelling, slamming doors in the hallway until around 2 in the morning. Without a phone in the room you cant even call the staff. It was miserable. Overall, the hotel was pretty much what we paid for and with the exception of the excellent staff, unremarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Value for mone”
Reviews.Author: PerthFamilyof5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night so we could get in and out of airport quickly. We walked there with our cases (and kids). It is really close to the airport. The room was small but perfect for what we required which was just a place to sleep and a warm shower. The room was very clean. It had a queen bed and bunk bed. A small desk with a alarm clock, lamp and television over the top. The bathroom was very small but functional with a shower, basin and toilet. We used the space under the bunk bed for our cases, and still had room for a pram and other bags. The air conditioning unit worked perfectly. The hotel is next door to a Dunkin donuts that is open all night. The airport was a short walk from which we caught the train to Sydney (Circular Quay) from and then a Ferry to Manly. The foyer of the hotel has vending machinese one of them has frozen meals that you can purchase then use the microwaves nearby to heat. There are also machines for softdrinks and snacks. Internet access and phone boxes are also available. The room was cheap by Sydney standards and great for a transit stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Fiddlee1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights at New Years when the whole city centre was booked up. They had a basic room with queen bed, desk, tv, and ensuite for a really good price and the room was clean and comfortable. The staff was courteous and extremely organized for New Years Eve with a shuttle running to and from the city centre. It's a 15 minute walk to the bus stop in Mascot. Don't do the walk alone, take a taxi. You can also walk there from the domestic airport terminal (12 minutes) and they offer shuttles to the domestic and international terminals. The bed was comfortable, there was no airport noise, and I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “depressing”
Reviews.Author: AucklandVisitor
Reviews.Content: I thought it would be fine to book somewhere really basic as it was just somewhere to sleep before catching an early flight. When I got there I was surprised to see an upper bunk connected to my double bed (over where my head would be). Very claustraphobic. The window blind was pulled down - if you open it you can been seen easily from the street (as I was walking towards the hotel I got a full on view of an older bloke's beer belly as he walked past the window - not a pretty sight!). The shower/toilet room had no outside window. Overall the room felt completely claustraphobic. I took a deep breath and thought it's only to sleep in, it'll be okay. After taking a shower I climbed into bed to find a hole in the sheet and I found a couple of hairs too. Disgusting. I would have walked out but I was so tired that I tried to pretend that it hadn't happened. Location: about an 8-10 minute walk from domestic terminal. It was a bit of a struggle with a heavy suitcase but it was too close to ask a taxi driver to take me there. Staff were friendly & helpful but I'd never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for very clean accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Glasgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night in order to catch an early flight the next am. Really convenient loaction next to airport ( took about 10/12 walk with all our bags). The rooms are basic but do provide everything you need for $84, they are also very clean with air con. They also operate a shuttle bus to the airport every 30 minutes commencing at 5am for $4.50.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but Great Value”
Reviews.Author: The_Y-man
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Sep 2007 for one night. Hotel location is an easy 10 minute stroll from Domestic Terminal, next door to Krispy Kreme Donuts. Extremely fast check in (fastest ever of any hotels we have stayed at) and check out (again, another record). Staff very friendly. Rooms are small but functional. Shower design leaves water all over bathroom floor. Only 2 bath towels provided - no floor towel. 2 plastic cups and a bar of soap are the only other supplies. Ironing faciltites in common laundry on ground floor. There is no fridge in the room, nor are there tea/coffee making facilities in the room (no kettle). Vending machines selling coffee, snacks and Lean Cuisine is located next to reception. A microwave is also available in the communal kitchen. Hair dryers (very good units) can be borrowed from reception. A fully refundable $20 deposit is required. Only free to air TV channels available The air conditioning was somewhat noisy and some question on effectiveness. Despite jets flying straight overhead, external noise was not an issue. Overall, a very basic, but extremely economical place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great but noisy before everyone goes to bed.”
Reviews.Author: room_check
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Formule 1 on numerous occasions and always found it to be convenient, cheap hotel close to the airport. Every time I stay there the rate seems go up, the last time it was $84 a night, but there is no charge for parking now so that's a plus. Its long corridors, cheap carpet and heavy automatic closing doors make for a noisy nights sleep. When the room doors close near-by you certainly hear them. But once you're accustomed to them, they are not a problem. Positives: Great value, close to airport, friendly and helpful staff, air-conditioned rooms, very clean rooms and linen, airport facing rooms have a great view, double glazing, next door to Krispy Kreme. Negatives: Noisy at night before everyone goes to bed.

Reviews.Title: “Double glazed windows were great!”
Reviews.Author: Kyls40
Reviews.Content: Very basic rooms, but clean, tidy and fairly new. The rooms were suprisingly quiet - did not hear a peep. Breakfast was good - nice to see the vegemite again after an extended holiday overseas. Manager and other staff were very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel and it was very well-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sparky81
Reviews.Content: Small room, basic clean facilities (no cooking), but all you need for a cheap airport stopover if arriving late or leaving early. Air conditioned. Free airport transfer, helpful staff, breakfast (only) available. Good value for money.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Formule 1 Sydney Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 5 Ross Smith Avenue | Mascot, Sydney, New South Wales 2020, Australia
